channel.title: theBalancedBriefNLmoneyAndMarkets
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from theBalancedBriefNLmoneyAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: I’m 88 and leaving my $450,000 estate to my son because he has children. Is that wrong?
item.description: “My other children have relationships, but they are unmarried and have no children.”

item.title: My in-laws, 95, are leaving us $250K. What’s the smart way to invest this money?
item.description: “They have a low income and do not file taxes.”

item.title: Social Security is on track to be insolvent in less than 10 years — but its commissioner says there’s ‘plenty of time’ to find a solution
item.description: The Old-Age and Survivors Insurance fund is expected to run out of money by 2033 at the latest, recent reports show.
